verses.verse: At the <S%H7093>end<s%> of every <S%H7651>seven<s%> <S%H8141>years<s%> thou shalt <S%H6213>make<s%> a <S%H8059>release<s%>.

And this is the <S%H1697>manner<s%> of the <S%H8059>release<s%>: every <S%H4874>creditor<s%> shall <S%H8058>release<s%> that which he hath <S%H5383>lent<s%> unto his <S%H7453>neighbor<s%>; he shall not <S%H5065>exact<s%> it of his <S%H7453>neighbor<s%> and his <S%H251>brother<s%>; because <S%H3068>Jehovah<s%>'s <S%H8059>release<s%> hath been <S%H7121>proclaimed<s%>.
Of a <S%H5237>foreigner<s%> thou mayest <S%H5065>exact<s%> <S%H251>it<s%>: but whatsoever of thine is with thy brother thy <S%H3027>hand<s%> shall <S%H8058>release<s%>.

Howbeit <S%H657><s%> there shall be no <S%H34>poor<s%> with <S%H3068>thee<s%>; (for Jehovah will <S%H1288>surely<s%> <S%H1288>bless<s%> thee in the <S%H776>land<s%> which <S%H3068>Jehovah<s%> thy <S%H430>God<s%> <S%H5414>giveth<s%> thee for an <S%H5159>inheritance<s%> to possess <S%H3423>it<s%>;)

if only thou <S%H8085>diligently<s%> <S%H8085>hearken<s%> unto the <S%H6963>voice<s%> of <S%H3068>Jehovah<s%> thy <S%H430>God<s%>, to <S%H8104>observe<s%> to <S%H6213>do<s%> all this <S%H4687>commandment<s%> which I <S%H6680>command<s%> thee this <S%H3117>day<s%>.

For <S%H3068>Jehovah<s%> thy <S%H430>God<s%> will <S%H1288>bless<s%> <S%H1696>thee<s%>, as he promised <S%H5670>thee<s%>: and thou shalt lend unto <S%H7227>many<s%> <S%H1471>nations<s%>, but thou shalt not <S%H5670>borrow<s%>; and thou shalt <S%H4910>rule<s%> over <S%H7227>many<s%> <S%H1471>nations<s%>, but they shall not rule over <S%H4910>thee<s%>.

If there be with thee a poor <S%H34>man<s%>, <S%H259>one<s%> of thy <S%H251>brethren<s%>, within <S%H259>any<s%> of thy <S%H8179>gates<s%> in thy <S%H776>land<s%> which <S%H3068>Jehovah<s%> thy <S%H430>God<s%> <S%H5414>giveth<s%> <S%H553>thee<s%>, thou shalt not harden thy <S%H3824>heart<s%>, nor <S%H7092>shut<s%> thy <S%H3027>hand<s%> from thy <S%H34>poor<s%> <S%H251>brother<s%>;

but thou shalt <S%H6605>surely<s%> <S%H6605>open<s%> thy <S%H3027>hand<s%> unto <S%H5670>him<s%>, and shalt surely <S%H5670>lend<s%> him <S%H1767>sufficient<s%> for his <S%H4270>need<s%> in that which he <S%H2637>wanteth<s%>.

Beware <S%H8104><s%> that there be not a <S%H1100>base<s%> <S%H1697>thought<s%> in thy <S%H3824>heart<s%>, <S%H559>saying<s%>, The <S%H7651>seventh<s%> <S%H8141>year<s%>, the <S%H8141>year<s%> of <S%H8059>release<s%>, is at <S%H7126>hand<s%>; and thine <S%H5869>eye<s%> be <S%H7489>evil<s%> against thy <S%H34>poor<s%> <S%H251>brother<s%>, and thou <S%H5414>give<s%> him <S%H7121>nought<s%>; and he cry unto <S%H3068>Jehovah<s%> against <S%H2399>thee<s%>, and it be sin unto thee.

Thou shalt <S%H5414>surely<s%> <S%H5414>give<s%> <S%H3824>him<s%>, and thy heart shall not be <S%H3415>grieved<s%> when thou <S%H5414>givest<s%> unto <S%H1558>him<s%>; because that for this <S%H1697>thing<s%> <S%H3068>Jehovah<s%> thy <S%H430>God<s%> will <S%H1288>bless<s%> thee in all thy <S%H4639>work<s%>, and in all that thou <S%H4916>puttest<s%> thy hand <S%H3027>unto<s%>.

For the <S%H34>poor<s%> will never <S%H2308>cease<s%> out <S%H7130>of<s%> the <S%H776>land<s%>: therefore I <S%H6680>command<s%> <S%H559>thee<s%>, saying, Thou shalt <S%H6605>surely<s%> <S%H6605>open<s%> thy <S%H3027>hand<s%> unto thy <S%H251>brother<s%>, to thy <S%H34>needy<s%>, and to thy <S%H6041>poor<s%>, in thy <S%H776>land<s%>.

If thy <S%H251>brother<s%>, a Hebrew <S%H5680>man<s%>, or a Hebrew <S%H5680>woman<s%>, be <S%H4376>sold<s%> unto <S%H5647>thee<s%>, and serve thee <S%H8337>six<s%> <S%H8141>years<s%>; then in the <S%H7637>seventh<s%> <S%H8141>year<s%> thou shalt let him <S%H7971>go<s%> free from <S%H2670>thee<s%>.
And when thou <S%H7971>lettest<s%> him go <S%H2670>free<s%> from <S%H7971>thee<s%>, thou shalt not let him go <S%H7387>empty<s%>:

thou shalt <S%H6059>furnish<s%> him <S%H6059>liberally<s%> out of thy <S%H6629>flock<s%>, and out of thy <S%H1637>threshing-floor<s%>, and out of thy <S%H3342>winepress<s%>; as <S%H3068>Jehovah<s%> thy <S%H430>God<s%> hath <S%H1288>blessed<s%> thee thou shalt give unto <S%H5414>him<s%>.

And thou shalt <S%H2142>remember<s%> that thou wast a <S%H5650>bondman<s%> in the <S%H776>land<s%> of <S%H4714>Egypt<s%>, and <S%H3068>Jehovah<s%> thy <S%H430>God<s%> <S%H6299>redeemed<s%> <S%H6680>thee<s%>: therefore I command thee this <S%H1697>thing<s%> <S%H3117>to-day<s%>.
And it shall <S%H559>be<s%>, if he say unto <S%H3318>thee<s%>, I will not go out from <S%H157>thee<s%>; because he loveth thee and thy <S%H1004>house<s%>, because he is well with <S%H2895>thee<s%>;

then thou shalt <S%H3947>take<s%> an <S%H4836>awl<s%>, and <S%H5414>thrust<s%> it through his <S%H241>ear<s%> unto the <S%H1817>door<s%>, and he shall be thy <S%H5650>servant<s%> for <S%H5769>ever<s%>. And also unto thy <S%H519>maid-servant<s%> thou shalt do <S%H6213>likewise<s%>.

It shall not seem <S%H7185>hard<s%> unto <S%H5869>thee<s%>, when thou lettest him <S%H7971>go<s%> <S%H2670>free<s%> from <S%H4932>thee<s%>; for to the double of the <S%H7939>hire<s%> of a <S%H7916>hireling<s%> hath he <S%H5647>served<s%> thee <S%H8337>six<s%> <S%H8141>years<s%>: and <S%H3068>Jehovah<s%> thy <S%H430>God<s%> will <S%H1288>bless<s%> thee in all that thou <S%H6213>doest<s%>.

All the <S%H1060>firstling<s%> <S%H2145>males<s%> that are <S%H3205>born<s%> of thy <S%H1241>herd<s%> and of thy <S%H6629>flock<s%> thou shalt <S%H6942>sanctify<s%> unto <S%H3068>Jehovah<s%> thy <S%H430>God<s%>: thou shalt do no <S%H5647>work<s%> with the <S%H1060>firstling<s%> of thy <S%H7794>herd<s%>, nor <S%H1494>shear<s%> the <S%H1060>firstling<s%> of thy <S%H6629>flock<s%>.

Thou shalt <S%H398>eat<s%> it <S%H6440>before<s%> <S%H3068>Jehovah<s%> thy <S%H430>God<s%> <S%H8141>year<s%> by <S%H8141>year<s%> in the <S%H4725>place<s%> which <S%H3068>Jehovah<s%> shall <S%H977>choose<s%>, thou and thy <S%H1004>household<s%>.

And if it have any <S%H3971>blemish<s%>, as if it be <S%H6455>lame<s%> or <S%H5787>blind<s%>, any <S%H7451>ill<s%> <S%H3971>blemish<s%> <S%H2076>whatsoever<s%>, thou shalt not sacrifice it unto <S%H3068>Jehovah<s%> thy <S%H430>God<s%>.

Thou shalt <S%H398>eat<s%> it within thy <S%H8179>gates<s%>: the <S%H2931>unclean<s%> and the <S%H2889>clean<s%> shall eat it <S%H3162>alike<s%>, as the <S%H6643>gazelle<s%>, and as the <S%H354>hart<s%>.
Only thou shalt not <S%H398>eat<s%> the <S%H1818>blood<s%> <S%H8210>thereof<s%>; thou shalt pour it out upon the <S%H776>ground<s%> as <S%H4325>water<s%>.
